{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3415350,"name":"Eliot Dunn","username":"Eliot","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/eliot/{size}/207280_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-14T00:53:01.690Z","cooked":"

MAXSpline Through Bore Encoder (7)3296×2547 1.12 MB

CAD, BOM

So, a few days ago I noticed that there wasn’t a direct on-shaft through bore solution for MAXSpline (or SplineXL). I decided to design one. I haven’t printed anything or tested anything, but it seems like it should work.
There is a configuration option to switch it from MAXSpline to SplineXL bore if you want.

SplineXL encoder

MAXSpline Through Bore Encoder (10)3296×2547 1.04 MB

Design

This is based heavily off of Redux’s through bore encoder upgrade. It uses the HELIUM Canandmag, and I designed the case and gears to be 3D printed. It uses 6807 bearings to support the MAXSpline gear, and a 10mm ID bearing to support the encoder gear. The REV (and TTB and WCP) bearings are a little bit more expensive then equivalent bearings you can find on amazon, so if you want to make this for yourself, probably look there.

MAXSpline Through Bore Encoder (8)3296×2547 1.2 MB

MAXSpline Through Bore Encoder (5)3296×2547 1.5 MB

Mounting

image1106×1739 135 KB

It mounts on four 1/4" heat-set inserts with a normal box tube pattern. The pivot is 1" away from the first holes.

Here’s an example of it being used:

MAXSpline Through Bore Encoder (4)3296×2547 614 KB

MAXSpline Through Bore Encoder (3)3296×2547 761 KB

MAXSpline Through Bore Encoder (9)3296×2547 809 KB

V1 with REV Through bore

My V1 design was a direct add on to the REV through bore. this was pretty hard to package, and backlash would be doubled as there would be two sets of gears.

REV-11-1271 (2)3296×2547 964 KB

REV-11-1271 (1)3296×2547 862 KB

REV-11-12713296×2547 1.01 MB

I hope this proves useful to someone. Please comment with any ideas or issues or questions! I might build this later, idk.

Awesome open source design!

Maybe I’ll have an excuse for a resin printer

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":56,"updated_at":"2024-08-14T01:04:07.682Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":805,"readers_count":804,"score":246.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":469836,"topic_slug":"maxspline-through-bore-encoder-helium-canandmag-addon","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":5}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":8002,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"177 & 429 | #TeamWCP| #TeamThrifty"},"post_url":"/t/maxspline-through-bore-encoder-helium-canandmag-addon/469836/2","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":5}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":5,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3415357,"name":"Skye Leake","username":"Skyehawk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/skyehawk/{size}/179363_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-14T01:09:32.149Z","cooked":"

Excellent, been missing for a while, thanks Eliot.

There will probably be some playing around to get the slipfit just right on the spline gear interface. As this is 3d printed there is some advantages to make the design squeeze onto the spline to eat up any slop there. There is a lot of spline interface on that gear, so you are in a good spot to play with optimal spline interface. I am not sure if this interface needs extra features (nubbins, tabs, etc) or not.

The reason I bring this up: many spline mechanisms will only operate in a small angular degree window, so designing for backlash mitigation and printer variablity is high on my list.

(Experimentation will determine if the single bearing on the magnet gear is sufficient)

Good work.

(That is all CD, stop asking if this is a complete sentence)

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":56,"updated_at":"2024-08-14T01:09:41.617Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":707,"readers_count":706,"score":331.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":469836,"topic_slug":"maxspline-through-bore-encoder-helium-canandmag-addon","display_username":"Andrew Schreiber","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":12}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":4297,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Here we go again"},"post_url":"/t/maxspline-through-bore-encoder-helium-canandmag-addon/469836/4","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":11},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":12,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3415361,"name":"Eliot Dunn","username":"Eliot","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/eliot/{size}/207280_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-14T01:16:24.148Z","cooked":"

Hm that’s really interesting, I might end up playing with compliant mechanisms for the fit.
I’m also kind of concerned how well the gears will print to mitigate backlash. There are some options in the gear featurescript I used that I could make configurable in the main model, but I’m not sure how well that would work. I do have the spline clearance configurable as of now.

Akash_Rastogi:

Maybe I’ll have an excuse for a resin printer

I think I designed it to be FDM printable, so hopefully you wouldn’t need one. Someone’s printing it right now to test fit, so we’ll see how that goes.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":56,"updated_at":"2024-08-14T01:16:24.148Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":690,"readers_count":689,"score":223.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":469836,"topic_slug":"maxspline-through-bore-encoder-helium-canandmag-addon","display_username":"Eliot Dunn","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":19235,"username":"Skyehawk","name":"Skye Leake","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/skyehawk/{size}/179363_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":5}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":52966,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"111 Alum"},"post_url":"/t/maxspline-through-bore-encoder-helium-canandmag-addon/469836/5","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3},{"id":"call_me_hand","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":5,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3415366,"name":"Skye Leake","username":"Skyehawk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/skyehawk/{size}/179363_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-14T01:35:03.636Z","cooked":"

I think you are correct to go with gears here, for ease and accessibility.

Let us suppose for a moment it is designed for ±180°, can you bias the encoder gear to one side with a super light weight torsion (clock mainspring style) or extension spring/rubber band? That way you won’t need to chase super fine dp gears.

This does make installing such that the preload is correct a bit more of a pain.

(There are other relatively straightforward zero backlash solutions outside of gears as well. )

(I may be mistaken, but the lowest backlash for a gearset may be a different CTC distance the CTC for optimal efficiency, but that is my gut, not a source)

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":56,"updated_at":"2024-08-14T01:41:34.506Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":640,"readers_count":639,"score":133.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":469836,"topic_slug":"maxspline-through-bore-encoder-helium-canandmag-addon","display_username":"Skye Leake","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":52966,"username":"Eliot","name":"Eliot Dunn","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/eliot/{size}/207280_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":19235,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Flyin' a hull |5934←2451←2767←876"},"post_url":"/t/maxspline-through-bore-encoder-helium-canandmag-addon/469836/6","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3415369,"name":"Eliot Dunn","username":"Eliot","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/eliot/{size}/207280_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-14T01:41:36.495Z","cooked":"
Skyehawk:

(Experimentation will determine if the single bearing on the magnet gear is sufficient)

It doesn’t fit right with me in my brain, but this is how both the REV through bore and how the Redux through bore work. So, I assume it will translate to this design. If not, I guess I need to try and design some bushing in there. The gears are also herringbone, so I hope that helps the magnet gear stay in.

image1920×878 115 KB

image1920×1047 66.1 KB

Skyehawk:

Let us suppose for a moment it is designed for ±180°, can you bias the encoder gear to one side with a super light weight torsion (clock mainspring style) or extension spring/rubber band? That way you won’t need to chase super fine dp gears.

That does make assembly quite a bit harder, as well as increasing the part count. Doing research into springs might be interesting.

Skyehawk:

(There are other relatively straightforward zero backlash solutions outside of gears as well. )

I did look into belts, I really wouldn’t trust a cantilivered pulley with this setup. I’m not sure what other ways I could look into.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":56,"updated_at":"2024-08-14T01:41:36.495Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":2,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":630,"readers_count":629,"score":156.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":469836,"topic_slug":"maxspline-through-bore-encoder-helium-canandmag-addon","display_username":"Eliot Dunn","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":52966,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"111 Alum"},"post_url":"/t/maxspline-through-bore-encoder-helium-canandmag-addon/469836/7","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3415370,"name":"Eeshwar Krishnan","username":"Eeshwar","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/eeshwar/{size}/195169_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-14T01:43:22.057Z","cooked":"

This is extremely cool! Super excited to download the files and try a test print of it.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":56,"updated_at":"2024-08-14T01:43:22.057Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":566,"readers_count":565,"score":233.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":469836,"topic_slug":"maxspline-through-bore-encoder-helium-canandmag-addon","display_username":"Eeshwar Krishnan","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":8}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53758,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Redux Robotics"},"post_url":"/t/maxspline-through-bore-encoder-helium-canandmag-addon/469836/8","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":8}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":8,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3415371,"name":"Skye Leake","username":"Skyehawk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/skyehawk/{size}/179363_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-14T01:48:19.698Z","cooked":"

Ok, you should be safe as long as you minimize the cantileaver, i see no reason not to follow rev/redux in this regard.

Possible to add a feature to catch an elastic band on the opposite side of the cantileaver (protruding past the bearing on the far side) and/or double stack that bearing (like how a versaplanatery output stage has 2 bearings)

I am just thinking it would be really cool to add an an elastic if you need to or not if you need large rotational freedom.

All excellent work! Just some food for thought

(As for other low backlash mechanisms: a capstan drive is one option, which would require proper tensioning and more encoder gear support,

Here is another option for limited travel

)

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":56,"updated_at":"2024-08-14T02:06:09.768Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":584,"readers_count":583,"score":136.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":469836,"topic_slug":"maxspline-through-bore-encoder-helium-canandmag-addon","display_username":"Skye Leake","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uvPSsUkLypY&t=15","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":2},{"url":"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uvPSsUkLypY","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":52966,"username":"Eliot","name":"Eliot Dunn","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/eliot/{size}/207280_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":19235,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Flyin' a hull |5934←2451←2767←876"},"post_url":"/t/maxspline-through-bore-encoder-helium-canandmag-addon/469836/9","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3415375,"name":"Anand Rajamani","username":"asid61","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/asid61/{size}/7179_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-14T01:58:04.320Z","cooked":"

Awesome work! I’ll definitely print one soon to check it out. One question, why the 6807 bearing over 6707? Easier to source?

Today was actually my first time learning about different metric bearing ids/numbers so I just used what was on vendor’s webpages and what people on discord told me. I think I’ll stick with the 6807 bearing now though, because it’s definitely easier to source and available from frc vendors.

","post_number":14,"post_type":1,"posts_count":56,"updated_at":"2024-08-14T11:43:08.966Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":511,"readers_count":510,"score":222.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":469836,"topic_slug":"maxspline-through-bore-encoder-helium-canandmag-addon","display_username":"Ryan Dognaux","primary_group_name":"Thriftybot","flair_name":"Thriftybot","flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":"","flair_color":"","flair_group_id":58,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":8}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":985,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"www.thethriftybot.com"},"post_url":"/t/maxspline-through-bore-encoder-helium-canandmag-addon/469836/14","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":8}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":8,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3415718,"name":"Greg Billetdeaux","username":"GregBilletdeaux","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gregbilletdeaux/{size}/137999_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-15T18:29:24.873Z","cooked":"

I printed and did a test assembly (without an encoder) today. I think it could use some retention on the encoder gear to keep it in place axially. Mine likes to float up and down with gravity. This is probably fine, but it ends up rubbing on the top plate, which already has a very thin wall right by the encoder. The herringbone isn’t able to keep it in place.

It could probably be mitigated by tolerancing it for my printer to get more of a press-fit. But it might be as simple as adding a threaded end to that gear, where you can put a small bolt and washer to keep it retained against the bearing. That way you’re not reliant on printer settings.

This is super awesome, though. We will keep it in our back pocket if we use spline again next year.

","post_number":15,"post_type":1,"posts_count":56,"updated_at":"2024-08-15T18:29:56.753Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":497,"readers_count":496,"score":134.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":469836,"topic_slug":"maxspline-through-bore-encoder-helium-canandmag-addon","display_username":"Greg Billetdeaux","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":35291,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"930 Head Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/maxspline-through-bore-encoder-helium-canandmag-addon/469836/15","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3415790,"name":"Eliot Dunn","username":"Eliot","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/eliot/{size}/207280_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-15T21:41:53.120Z","cooked":"

I just printed V10 (heh I’ve been doing a lot of iterations).

PXL_20240815_210656102.MP1920×2550 230 KB

PXL_20240815_2107011601920×2550 396 KB

PXL_20240815_2107415461920×2550 422 KB

I have the large bearings right now, the small ones come on Monday (along with two Canandmags that redux sent for free, thank you so much!) I’ll also get this printed with my friend’s bambu instead of my ender 3 V2 for hopefully better tolerances.

I realized that I didn’t add enough tolerance for hole sizes so I added more there.

GregBilletdeaux:

it might be as simple as adding a threaded end to that gear, where you can put a small bolt and washer to keep it retained against the bearing.

That’s hard to do, the magnet that comes with the Canandmag as well as the cancoder is 0.5" long, so it takes up quite a lot of space. I did increase the thickness of the wall between the encoder and the gear, so it probably wouldn’t get worn that much.

image1625×1023 117 KB

It seems like the gears aren’t meshing at the C-C because of printer tolerance issues, so I think I’m going to make a C-C adder configurable next version.

","post_number":16,"post_type":1,"posts_count":56,"updated_at":"2024-08-15T21:41:53.120Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":503,"readers_count":502,"score":225.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":469836,"topic_slug":"maxspline-through-bore-encoder-helium-canandmag-addon","display_username":"Eliot Dunn","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":6}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":52966,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"111 Alum"},"post_url":"/t/maxspline-through-bore-encoder-helium-canandmag-addon/469836/16","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":5},{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":6,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3415799,"name":"Skye Leake","username":"Skyehawk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/skyehawk/{size}/179363_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-15T22:32:07.917Z","cooked":"

Could you make a small bushing surface to touch off on the magnet with a bit of clearence? I know it is far from ideal, but the loads are very low radially so you may be just fine.

image (2)~21625×1023 168 KB

Oh, and while you are iterating: clocking marks are ALWAYS appreciated to help get things aligned properly (or at least good enough) if taken apart in the pits, for the spline and the gears.

Good work so far!

","post_number":17,"post_type":1,"posts_count":56,"updated_at":"2024-08-15T22:34:46.868Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":16,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":475,"readers_count":474,"score":185.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":469836,"topic_slug":"maxspline-through-bore-encoder-helium-canandmag-addon","display_username":"Skye Leake","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":52966,"username":"Eliot","name":"Eliot Dunn","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/eliot/{size}/207280_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":6}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":19235,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Flyin' a hull |5934←2451←2767←876"},"post_url":"/t/maxspline-through-bore-encoder-helium-canandmag-addon/469836/17","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":6}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":6,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3415826,"name":"Eeshwar Krishnan","username":"Eeshwar","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/eeshwar/{size}/195169_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-16T01:14:48.091Z","cooked":"
Eliot:

That’s hard to do, the magnet that comes with the Canandmag as well as the cancoder is 0.5" long, so it takes up quite a lot of space. I did increase the thickness of the wall between the encoder and the gear, so it probably wouldn’t get worn that much.

It increases the BOM slightly, but technically any diametrically magnetized magnet will work (given sufficient magnet strength, I try not to go under 6mm x 2mm N30). These are a favourite of mine for random projects, but I’d probably advise a slightly thicker one for something like this.. Although, it using the included magnet is pretty cool.

Side note: Printed it out and the encoder fit is pretty good. Ignore the bad print quality, made it at 200% speed on a mk3s.

image1920×2560 344 KB

image1920×2560 290 KB

","post_number":18,"post_type":1,"posts_count":56,"updated_at":"2024-08-16T01:15:34.746Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":16,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":497,"readers_count":496,"score":274.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":469836,"topic_slug":"maxspline-through-bore-encoder-helium-canandmag-addon","display_username":"Eeshwar Krishnan","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.digikey.com/en/products/detail/radial-magnets-inc/8995/5126077","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"8995 Radial Magnets, Inc. | Sensors, Transducers | DigiKey","clicks":13}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":10}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53758,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Redux Robotics"},"post_url":"/t/maxspline-through-bore-encoder-helium-canandmag-addon/469836/18","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":10}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":10,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3416705,"name":"Eliot Dunn","username":"Eliot","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/eliot/{size}/207280_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-20T03:41:40.892Z","cooked":"

I just got all of the parts and also got my friend to 3d print parts on his P1s.

Backlash appears to be less than 0.5 degrees, I need to actually measure it though. The resolution on REV’s hardware client is 0.36 degrees, so it’s hard to measure without connecting it to CAN.

The biggest issue right now is that the encoder mounting is too loose, and it can wiggle around. I think the tolerance highly depends on the printer, though. I might try and have different presets on the model for different printers.

Overall I’m very happy with this!
